intro: Phaulopsis angolana, commonly known as the Angolan daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other similar plants. The plant features showy yellow flowers surrounded by white ray florets, making it visually striking. It typically grows in open grasslands and is adapted to dry conditions. Phaulopsis angolana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
